Input.name: Input
Input.description:
Autocomplete enables users to quickly find and select from a pre-populated list of values as they type, leveraging searching and filtering.

The widget is based on popular jQuery UI Autocomplete widget, but it brings some advanced built-in features:

* caching
* tokenizing
* using DOM as a source of suggestions
* auto-fill
* built-in button

Output.name: Output
Output.description: A widget for creating data chart

Select.name: Select
Select.description: A widget providing sorting capabilities for a list of elements

autocomplete.name: autocomplete
autocomplete.description:
Autocomplete enables users to quickly find and select from a pre-populated list of values as they type, leveraging searching and filtering.

The widget is based on popular jQuery UI Autocomplete widget, but it brings some advanced built-in features:

* caching
* tokenizing
* using DOM as a source of suggestions
* auto-fill
* built-in button

chart.name: chart
chart.description: A widget for creating data chart

orderingList.name: orderingList
orderingList.description: A widget providing sorting capabilities for a list of elements

pickList.name: pickList
pickList.description: A widget providing selection and sorting capabilities for a list of elements

classitems.description: The delay in milliseconds between when a keystroke occurs and when a search is performed. A zero-delay makes sense for local data (more responsive), but can produce a lot of load for remote data, while being less responsive.
classitems.name: delay

classitems.description:
Allows to repeat auto-completion several times by using separator between words.

You can provide multiple tokens.
classitems.name: token

classitems.description: Allows to append a button to the input to allow opening suggestion box by mouse.
classitems.name: showButton

classitems.description: Auto focusing mode selects first suggestion in a list once it appears, so user can just confirm it using enter key.
classitems.name: autoFocus

classitems.description: Auto filling mode previews a selected suggestion in the input as a user types.
classitems.name: autoFill

classitems.description:
Defines the data to use, must be specified.

**Multiple types supported:**

* **Array:** An array can be used for local data.There are two supported formats:
   * An array of strings: `[ "Choice1", "Choice2" ]`
   * An array of objects with `label` and `value` properties: `[ { label: "Choice1", value: "value1" }, ... ]`

   The label property is displayed in the suggestion menu. The value will be inserted into the input element when a user selects an item. If just one property is specified, it will be used for both, e.g., if you provide only value properties, the value will also be used as the label.

* **String:** When a string is used, the Autocomplete plugin expects that string to point to a URL resource that will return JSON data. It can be on the same host or on a different one (must provide JSONP). The Autocomplete plugin does not filter the results, instead a query string is added with a term field, which the server-side script should use for filtering the results. For example, if the source option is set to "http://example.com" and the user types foo, a GET request would be made to http://example.com?term=foo. The data itself can be in the same format as the local data described above.

* **Function:** The third variation, a callback, provides the most flexibility and can be used to connect any data source to Autocomplete. The callback gets two arguments:
   * A request object, with a single term property, which refers to the value currently in the text input. For example, if the user enters "new yo" in a city field, the Autocomplete term will equal "new yo".
   * A response callback, which expects a single argument: the data to suggest to the user. This data should be filtered based on the provided term, and can be in any of the formats described above for simple local data. It's important when providing a custom source callback to handle errors during the request. You must always call the response callback even if you encounter an error. This ensures that the widget always has the correct state.

   When filtering data locally, you can make use of the built-in $.ui.autocomplete.escapeRegex function. It'll take a single string argument and escape all regex characters, making the result safe to pass to new RegExp().
classitems.name: source

classitems.description: The minimum number of characters a user must type before a search is performed. Zero is useful for local data with just a few items, but a higher value should be used when a single character search could match a few thousand items.
classitems.name: minLength

classitems.description:
Turns suggestions caching on.

In caching mode, autocomplete first tries to look suggestions for given term up in cache given by
`cacheImplementation` option and if no suggestions are found, autocomplete uses classic `source`
to retrieve suggestions.
classitems.name: cached

classitems.description:
Allows to plug in implementation of cache, which in turn allows to use stores like Local Storage
for remembering values.

`cacheImplementation` is an class with two methods:

- `function get(searchTerm)` - returns all cached suggestions for given searchTerm prefix
- `function set(searchTerm, suggestions)` - stores all provided suggestions into cache under given searchTerm prefix
classitems.name: cacheImplementation

classitems.description:
Function that determines what prefix of search term will be used to query a cache:

`function cachePrefixExtract(searchTerm)` - default implementation extracts first `minLength` characters of a search term
classitems.name: cachePrefixExtract

classitems.description:
Provide function which will be used to filter array of suggestions by given searchTerm:

`function filter(array, searchTerm)`
classitems.name: filter

classitems.description: Which element the menu should be appended to. When the value is null, the parents of the input field will be checked for a class of ui-front. If an element with the ui-front class is found, the menu will be appended to that element. Regardless of the value, if no element is found, the menu will be appended to the body.
classitems.name: appendTo

classitems.description: Disables the autocomplete if set to true.
classitems.name: disabled

classitems.description: Identifies the position of the suggestions menu in relation to the associated input element. The of option defaults to the input element, but you can specify another element to position against. You can refer to the jQuery UI Position utility for more details about the various options.
classitems.name: position

classitems.description:
Triggered when search is triggered but before raw suggestions are parsed/processed.

It gives chance to update `source` of suggestions as reflection to current search term.

function update(request [, doneCallback])

* `request` is object which contains search term: `{ term: 'searchTerm' }`
* when `doneCallback` is provided, widget will wait until `doneCallback` is called. Usually it is called on the end of AJAX data update.
classitems.name: update

classitems.description: Triggered when the field is blurred, if the value has changed.
classitems.name: change

classitems.description: Triggered when the menu is hidden. Not every close event will be accompanied by a change event.
classitems.name: close

classitems.description: Triggered when the autocomplete is created.
classitems.name: create

classitems.description:
Triggered when focus is moved to an item (not selecting).
The default action is to replace the text field's value with the value of the focused item, though only if the event was triggered by a keyboard interaction.
Canceling this event prevents the value from being updated, but does not prevent the menu item from being focused.
classitems.name: focus

classitems.description: Triggered when the suggestion menu is opened or updated.
classitems.name: open

classitems.description:
Triggered after a search completes, before the menu is shown.
Useful for local manipulation of suggestion data, where a custom source option callback is not required.
This event is always triggered when a search completes, even if the menu will not be shown because there are no results or the Autocomplete is disabled.
classitems.name: response

classitems.description:
Triggered before a search is performed, after minLength and delay are met.
If canceled, then no request will be started and no items suggested.
classitems.name: search

classitems.description:
Triggered when an item is selected from the menu.
The default action is to replace the text field's value with the value of the selected item.
Canceling this event prevents the value from being updated, but does not prevent the menu from closing.
classitems.name: select

classitems.description: Closes the Autocomplete menu. Useful in combination with the search method, to close the open menu.
classitems.name: close

classitems.description: Removes the autocomplete functionality completely. This will return the element back to its pre-init state.
classitems.name: destroy

classitems.description: Disables the autocomplete.
classitems.name: disable

classitems.description: Enables the autocomplete.
classitems.name: enable

classitems.description:
`option( optionName )`

Gets an object containing key/value pairs representing the current autocomplete options hash.

`option()`

Gets an object containing key/value pairs representing the current autocomplete options hash.

`option( optionName, value )`

Sets the value of the autocomplete option associated with the specified optionName.

`option( options )`

Sets one or more options for the autocomplete.
classitems.name: option

classitems.description:
Triggers a search event and invokes the data source if the event is not canceled.
Can be used by a selectbox-like button to open the suggestions when clicked.
When invoked with no parameters, the current input's value is used.
classitems.name: search

classitems.description: Returns a jQuery object containing the menu element. Although the menu items are constantly created and destroyed, the menu element itself is created during initialization and is constantly reused.
classitems.name: widget

classitems.description: Redraw chart without axis ranges
classitems.name: resetZoom

classitems.description: Returns chart object
classitems.name: getPlotObject

classitems.description: Use the destroy method to clean up any modifications your widget has made to the DOM
classitems.name: destroy

classitems.description: Disable the orderingList widget
classitems.name: disabled

classitems.description: The text to use for the orderingList header
classitems.name: header

classitems.description: The height of the orderingList
classitems.name: height

classitems.description: The minimum height of the orderingList
classitems.name: heightMin

classitems.description: The maximum height of the orderingList
classitems.name: heightMax

classitems.description:
A CSS class to be added to the orderingList.
Multiple classes should be space separated
classitems.name: styleClass

classitems.description:
A CSS class to be added to each column of the orderingList when table layout is used.
Multiple classes should be space separated
classitems.name: columnClasses

classitems.description: When true, show the buttons for ordering the selected elements
classitems.name: showButtons
buttonsText

classitems.description: When true, it is not possible to move a selected element outside of the orderingList
classitems.name: contained

classitems.description:
When true dragging the mouse over the elements selects multiple elements.  This also reduces the drag handle
used to re-order the elements.
classitems.name: dragSelect

classitems.description: Allows elements to be dragged onto an empty list when true
classitems.name: dropOnEmpty

classitems.description: Allows elements to be ordered by drag and drop with the mouse when true
classitems.name: mouseOrderable

classitems.description: The String prefixed to all events triggered within the orderingList widget
classitems.name: widgetEventPrefix

classitems.description: Fired when the target list of the orderingList changes values.
classitems.name: change

classitems.description: Fired after the dynamically created DOM elements of the orderingList have been created
classitems.name: addDomElements

classitems.description: Fired after the orderingList has been created
classitems.name: create

classitems.description: Fired after the orderingList has been destroyed
classitems.name: destroy

classitems.description: Fired when the orderingList receives focus
classitems.name: focus

classitems.description: Fired when the orderingList loses focus
classitems.name: blur

classitems.description: Removes the orderingList functionality completely. This will return the element back to its pre-init state.
classitems.name: destroy

classitems.description: Disable the pickList widget
classitems.name: disabled

classitems.description: The text to use for the pickList header
classitems.name: header

classitems.description: The text to use for the source header of the pickList
classitems.name: sourceHeader

classitems.description: The text to use for the target header of the pickList
classitems.name: targetHeader

classitems.description: The height of the pickList

classitems.description: The minimum height of the pickList
classitems.name: heightMin

classitems.description: The maximum height of the pickList
classitems.name: heightMax

classitems.description:
A CSS class to be added to the pickList.
Multiple classes should be space separated
classitems.name: styleClass

classitems.description:
A CSS class to be added to each column of the pickList when table layout is used.
Multiple classes should be space separated
classitems.name: columnClasses

classitems.description: When true, clicking on a pickList element will move it between the source and target lists
classitems.name: switchByClick

classitems.description: When true, double-clicking on a pickList element will move it between the source and target lists
classitems.name: switchByDblClick

classitems.description: When true, elements in the target list can be re-ordered
classitems.name: orderable
orderButtonsText
pickButtonsText

classitems.description: The String prefixed to all events triggered within the pickList widget
classitems.name: widgetEventPrefix

classitems.description: Fired when the target list of the pickList changes values.
classitems.name: change

classitems.description: Fired after the dynamically created DOM elements of the pickList have been created
classitems.name: addDomElements

classitems.description: Fired after the pickList has been created

classitems.description: Fired after the pickList has been destroyed

classitems.description: Fired when the pickList receives focus

classitems.description: Fired when the pickList loses focus
classitems.name: blur

classitems.description: Removes the pickList functionality completely. This will return the element back to its pre-init state.
classitems.name: destroy

classitems.description: Move items from the target list of the pickList to the source list.

params.name: items
params.description: A list of Elements to remove from the target list of the pickList

params.name: event
params.description:
The event that triggered the removal of the elements.  This event will be made accessible
when the resulting change event is fired.

classitems.name: removeItems

classitems.description: Move items from the source list of the pickList to the target list.

params.name: items
params.description: A list of Elements to remove from the source list of the pickList

params.name: event
params.description:
The event that triggered the removal of the elements.  This event will be made accessible
when the resulting change event is fired.

classitems.name: addItems
